# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
in the centos8 docker image
install the rpm
start the installed shell
run new-pssession 
```

# Expected behavior

```none
error
```

# Actual behavior

```none
powershell exits
```

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none

```

comments.author: tomasruprich
comments.body:
Just a quick note with more details and possible hotfix. 

The full error:
```
New-PSSession : This parameter set requires WSMan, and no supported WSMan client library was found. WSMan is either not installed or unavailable for this system.
```

Caused by non-existing libcrypto and libssl libraries:
```
# ls -l /opt/microsoft/powershell/6/libcrypto.so.1.0.0 /opt/microsoft/powershell/6/libssl.so.1.0.0 
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 root root 22 Jan 22 20:34 /opt/microsoft/powershell/6/libcrypto.so.1.0.0 -> /lib64/libcrypto.so.10
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 root root 19 Jan 22 20:34 /opt/microsoft/powershell/6/libssl.so.1.0.0 -> /lib64/libssl.so.10
# ls -l /lib64/libcrypto.so.10 /lib64/libssl.so.10
ls: cannot access '/lib64/libssl.so.10': No such file or directory
ls: cannot access '/lib64/libcrypto.so.10': No such file or directory
```

Solved by:
```
# sudo yum install -y epel-release
# sudo yum install -y compat-openssl10

# ls -l /lib64/libcrypto.so.10 
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 root root 19 May 13  2019 /lib64/libcrypto.so.10 -> libcrypto.so.1.0.2o
# ls -l /lib64/libssl.so.10 
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 root root 16 May 13  2019 /lib64/libssl.so.10 -> libssl.so.1.0.2o

```

title: installing CentOS 8 rpm in Docker had links to SSL library which caused PowerShell to exit with New-PSSession
